revised_title: High-Frequency Corona Interaction of Carbon Dioxide and Hydrogen
tldr: The author investigates the interaction of carbon dioxide and hydrogen in a corona due to high-frequency alternating currents. They observe a unique discharge with intense luminosity and high-pitched sound, and find that the dielectric strength of the gas mixture reaches a maximum at a certain pressure. The research focuses on the chemical effects and electrical factors involved in the process, providing a detailed description of the experimental setup and methods.
